metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13464 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in OWASP ModSecurity Core Rule Set (CRS) 3.0.2. Useof X.Filename instead of X_Filename can bypass some PHP Script Uploadsrules, because PHP automatically transforms dots into underscores incertain contexts where dots are invalid.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

modsecurity-crs - 3.2.0-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: modsecurity: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'vulnerable code is part of the test suite, not production code').
modsecurity-crs package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.0-1').
